system.description: Leatherwork is a messy business, but you tan and treat with a deft hand resulting in durable leathers and lifelike furs. You gain proficiency with leatherworker’s tools, or if you are already proficient you gain an expertise die instead. During a long rest, if you have access to the skin of a medium or larger creature you can use your leatherworker's tools to convert the skin into a set of @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.3drq3cy8nbnll0oc]{Padded Leather Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.udd9a11ymhkbfekz]{Leather Brigandine Armor}, or a @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.QZJCGzkF1or7Wtok]{Mock Cloak}. A mock cloak can be worn as a normal cloak, and used to conceal the wearer as a bonus action. While concealed by a mock cloak the wearer appears to be the type of beast whose skin was used to create the mock cloak. The Perception, Investigation, or Nature check DC required to see through a mock cloak disguise is equal to your passive Intelligence leatherworker’s tools score. In addition, you have advantage on checks made to create schematics for leather items.
